Column Definition: A naming convention for the larger water body containing or connected (as a source) to the water body for which the data is for.
Source: The data source includes agencies in which data was collected, as well as USGS personnel, and a variety of websites sources (geonames.usgs.gov, google maps) as listed in the overall data set description.

Column Definition: Standardized naming convention for the water body in which the data is associated with to be used to merge to other data using the common water body name and a unique ID incorporating the name.
Source: Water body names came from the agencies (i.e. state, federal, tribal) collecting information and USGS personnel standardizing across the agencies.

Column Definition: Name of the county in which the water body is within. An individual water body can cross more than one county, so multiple counties may be listed. Additionally, in order to adhere to a unique ID a county name may be different than the associated GPS location if a water body crosses multiple counties and/or states.
Source: County names were supplied by agencies collecting the data, or added to water body locations using a spatial merge process within ArcGIS using census data from 2010 for the county spatial layer (http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger).

Column Definition: A four letter code derived from the first four letters from the county associated with the water body. Some county codes may differ than the county which the GPS point may fall within if the water body crosses more than one county.
Source: Naming convention of the first four letters from the county column or the standardized county code applied to that water body.

Column Definition: A two letter abbreviation for the state or province (BC=British Columbia) in which the water body falls within. At times a waterbody will cross more than one state and will have two listed or just one for naming convention purposes.
Source: Data source was from collecting agencies or USGS personnel.

Column Definition: Description of boat ramp location where available.
Source: Various sources from state, federal, provincial and local governing agencies.

Column Definition: A unique identifier code created for the water body. Unique ID was typically made up of the Water body_First four letters of the county name_state abbreviation. This was modified for water bodies that covered multiple states and counties to a simpler format, which may not include the county code and state abbreviation.
Source: USGS personnel.

Column Definition: Latitude in decimal degrees WGS84 for the boat ramp location.
Source: Obtained from various state, federal, provincial and local agencies and websites listed in the data sources metadata file.

Column Definition: Longitude in decimal degrees WGS84 for the boat ramp location.
Source: Obtained from various state, federal, provincial and local agencies and websites listed in the data sources metadata file.

Column Definition: Indicates whether the water body was inside the Columbia River Basin (CRB) by assigning a 1 to the record. For this data set only boat ramp locations within the CRB were included.
Source: USGS personnel through a spatial merge with a Columbia River Basin shapefile.

Column Definition: The latitude in decimal degrees WGS84 for a reference GPS point for the risk assessment data associated with the water body. This GPS point reference may or may not be the location where data was collected or the nearest location where data was collected or a reference location point assigned to the data collected.
Source: Obtained from various state, federal, provincial and local agencies and website listed in the data source section.

Column Definition: The longitude in decimal degrees WGS84 for a reference GPS point for the risk assessment data associated with the water body. This GPS point reference may or may not be the location where data was collected or the nearest location where data was collected or a reference location point assigned to the data collected.
Source: Obtained from various state, federal, provincial and local agencies and website listed in the data source section.

Column Definition: Mean calcium reported for the water body measured in mg/L.
Source: Various sources, primarily Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52. http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Mean pH value for water body as reported in Wells et al. 2011
Source: Various sources, primarily Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52. http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Risk of establishment categorical value assigned by Wells et al. 2011 based on Calcium levels. High > 25 mg/L, Medium > 15 - 25 mg/L, Low 12-15 mg/L, and Very Low < 12 mg/L
Source: Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: flagged ("flag") data indicates only 1 Calcium value was used for the ranking category and not a mean value as reported by Wells et al. 2011.
Source: Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Value assigned using mean values for dissolved CA and pH to predict presence/absence of Dreissenids mussels - Ramcharan et al. 1992 for methodology, reported in Wells et al. 2011.
Source: Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Value from States assigning a risk value to the water body obtained from the Wells et al. 2011.
Source: Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Rank (categorical) of introduction from Wells et al. 2011. Categories were assigned to different state metrics as follows: Oregon metric was day use days from triennial survey where Day use days represent any portion of a 24 hr period in which participants engaged in boating activity. Idaho metric was the number of tournaments from 2007 to 2009 on the water body. Montana was the total pressure (includes resident and non-resident pressure for angling from boat, shore, both (boat and shore) and ice fishing) on a water body. For Washington based on the 2007 Report on Washington State Parks and Recreation Commission survey question #43, on which bodies of water did you boat on in the past two years (multiple responses allowed). Ranking was performed on these indivdual metrics using quartiles as follows High > Q3, Medium > median - Q3, Low > Q1-Q3, Very Low 0-Q1.
Source: Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Rank (categorical) of introduction from Wells et al 2011. Categories were assigned to different state metrics as follows: Oregon metric was number of tournaments on a water body. Idaho was the total number of boats in tournaments on the water body. Montana was the non-resident pressure (includes non-resident pressure for angling from boat, shore, both (boat and shore) and ice fishing combined). Washington based on the 2007 Report on Washington State Parks and Recreation Commission survey question #68 On which body of water did you boat the most days in Washington in the past two years. Ranking was performed on these indivdual metrics using quartiles as follows High > Q3, Medium > median - Q3, Low > Q1-Q3, Very Low 0-Q1.
Source: Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Numerical ranking assigned to the categorical Roe ranking, Very low = 1, Low = 3, Medium=5, High=10
Source: USGS Personnel using Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Categorical ranking of risk of introduction-it is the highest value reported from either roi_1 and roi_2 as reported.
Source: USGS Personnel using Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Numerical ranking assigned from the categorical ranking of risk of introduction from Wells et al. 2011. Numerical ranking assigned as follows:Very low = 1, Low = 3, Medium=5, High=10.
Source: USGS Personnel using Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Sum of Roi_rank and Roe_Rank numerical values, missing values may be possible for either of the Roi or Roe rank values.
Source: USGS Personnel using Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Sum of the addition of Roi_rank and Roe_rank for water bodies where both values are present, otherwise "." if only one value was reported.
Source: USGS Personnel using Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Trips represent the number of days leaving a residence to go boating during 2008, Oregon metric.
Source: Oregon State Marine Board Triennial Survey Results 2008 and data sources from Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Trips represent number of days leaving a residence to go boating during 2010, Oregon metric
Source: Oregon State Marine Board Triennial Survey Results 2010

Column Definition: The average number of days leaving a residence to go boating for 2008 and 2010 metrics combined, Oregon
Source: USGS personnel and data sources obtained from Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Represents the number of days in which any portion of a 24 hr period in which a participant engaged in boating activity in 2008, Oregon metric.
Source: Oregon State Marine Board Triennial Survey Results 2008 and data sources from Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Represents the number of days in which any portion of a 24 hr period in which participant engaged in boating activity in 2010, Oregon metric.
Source: Oregon State Marine Board Triennial Survey Results 2010.

Column Definition: The average day use days of 2008 and 2010 combined metrics, Oregon metric.
Source: USGS personnel and data sources obtained from Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10, and Oregon State Marine Board Triennial Survey Results 2010.

Column Definition: Size data (surface value in acres) collected by USGS personnel from many internet references and state metric reports.
Source: Obtained from various state, federal, provincial and local agencies and websites listed in the data source section. Data is provided as an approximate reference.

Column Definition: The number of participants divide by 2 for tournaments in 2012, this is a surrogate for the number of boats participating. Idaho metric.
Source: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

Column Definition: The number of tournaments during 2012, summarized from reported tournament results. Idaho metric.
Source: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

Column Definition: Number of registered angling tournaments for 2006, 2007 and 2008 for the water body. Ranged from 0 to 101. Idaho metric.
Source: Idaho Department of Fish and Game and data sources collected from Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: Number of boats participating in all tournaments during 2006, 2007 and 2008. Idaho metric.
Source: Idaho Department of Fish and Game and data sources collected from Wells et al. 2011,Prioritizing Zebra and Quagga Mussel Monitoring in the Columbia River Basin. Prepared for Bonneville Power Administration and Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. BPA Contract Number: 00003373, TI Project Number: 52.http://pdxscholar.library.pdx.edu/centerforlakes_pub/10.

Column Definition: 100th meridian count of day use days, 1-29. 100th Meridian Initiative Boater surveys. Tallies collected from questions that asked last three places you boated, and name the next three places you plan on boating. Idaho metric.
Source: 100th Meridian Initiative Boater surveys

Column Definition: Number of boat ramps per water body determined using shapefile generated from Idaho Boating Facilities Guide 1998 and from WA state metrics.
Source: Washington Dept. of Fish and Wildlife and Idaho Boating Facilities Guide 1998 and Google earth satellite imagery.

Column Definition: Calcium data (mg/L) from ISDA 2011 for the water body. Idaho metric.
Source: Idaho State Department of Agriculture 2011, unpublished data.

Column Definition: Priority ranking supplied by ISDA for 2014 early detection and monitoring efforts, data from 2011 report and ranking methodology. Idaho metric.
Source: Idaho State Department of Agriculture 2011, unpublished data.

Column Definition: Elevation of water body in feet. From many of the states (WA, MT, and other resources), provided as an approximate reference value.
Source: Obtained from various state, federal, provincial and local agencies and website listed in the item description.

Column Definition: 1= motors allowed. 0 = no motors allowed. WA metric.
Source: Obtained from various Washington websites listed in the data sources description.

Column Definition: 1= fishing allowed. 0 = means no fishing allowed. WA metric.
Source: Obtained from various Washington websites listed in the data sources description.

Column Definition: Number of marinas on water body. WA metric.
Source: Obtained from various Washington websites listed in the data sources description.

Column Definition: 1 = cold water fish species present. 0 = no cold water fish species present. WA metric.
Source: Obtained from various Washington websites listed in the data sources description.

Column Definition: 1 = warm water species present. 0 = no warm water species present. WA metric.
Source: Obtained from various Washington websites listed in the data sources description.

Column Definition: Number of fishing reports submitted on a waterbody on http://www.washingtonlakes.com/ . For this report individual fishing reports were collected for the period of 1/1/2010 to 12/31/2013 for lakes and rivers where boats were used. A fishing report was counted if the angler reported the methods ‘Bottom Fishing From Boat’ or ‘Top Fishing From Boat’. If the angler reported the methods ‘Trolling’, ‘Other’ or failed to report any fishing method, the narrative of the report was read to see if a boat was used. For each lake and river in Washington State the number of boater fishing reports were tallied. WA metric.
Source: http://www.washingtonlakes.com accessed February 2014.

Column Definition: Number of individual anglers submitting fishing report on on a waterbody at http://www.washingtonlakes.com/ . For this report individual fishing reports were collected for the period of 1/1/2010 to 12/31/2013 for lakes and rivers where boats were used. A fishing report was counted if the angler reported the methods ‘Bottom Fishing From Boat’ or ‘Top Fishing From Boat’. If the angler reported the methods ‘Trolling’, ‘Other’ or failed to report any fishing method, the narrative of the report was read to see if a boat was used. In those cases where it was clear that a boat was used these reports were also entered. For each lake and river in Washington State the number of boater fishing reports were tallied as well as the individual fishermen (USER) who wrote the reports. In many cases one USER would report on the same waterbody about fishing trips that occurred on different dates. WA metric.
Source: http://www.washingtonlakes.com accessed February 2014.

Column Definition: Alternate stream names for MT, as supplied by MFWP personnel. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Length of stream or section of stream in miles. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Major river drainage in which the water body is located. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Montana Fish, Wildlife and Park region (7 regions). MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Indicates angling pressure was either by boat or by both boat and shore, by a value = 1. MT metric. Entered by USGS personnel.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Angling pressure for an individual water by the number of residency types (both resident and nonresident). Angling can be by boat, shore, both or ice fishing. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Error statistic calculated by MFWP. There is a formula on page 9 of their summary report. Montana Statewide Angling Pressure 2011 Report Summary.pdf. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Number of trips to a waterbody, 1 trip = 1 visit.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Angling pressure for an individual water body by the number of Montana resident anglers
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Error statistic calculated by MT. There is a formula on page 9 of their summary report. Montana Statewide Angling Pressure 2011 Report Summary.pdf
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Number of trips to a water body by MT resident anglers. 1 trip = 1 visit.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Angling pressure for an individual water body by the number of non-resident anglers.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Error statistic calculated by MFWP for non-resident pressure error. There is a formula on page 9 of their summary report. Montana Statewide Angling Pressure 2011 Report Summary.pdf
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Number of trips to a water body by non-resident anglers. 1 trip = 1 visit to the waterbody. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: State Rank from Montana Report. No explanation was found in the Montana Statewide Angling Pressure 2011 Report Summary.pdf to indicate how these were done. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.

Column Definition: Regional Rank from MT Report. No explanation was found in the Montana Statewide Angling Pressure 2011 Report Summary.pdf to indicate how these were done. MT metric.
Source: Montana State Fish, Wildlife and Parks 2011 Angling Pressure Report,http://fwp.mt.gov/fishing/anglingData/anglingPressureSurveys/2011.html.
